public speaking.title: Hello World!
public speaking.description: Say hello to a stranger until you get a greeting in return.
public speaking.tip: Try picking someone who's smiling, happy people are more likely to want to talk.

public speaking.title: Charades
public speaking.description: Play a game of charades with your family.
public speaking.tip: You'll look silly while acting things out, but so will everyone else, so don't worry and try to get laughs.

public speaking.title: Show & Tell
public speaking.description: Find something cool and show it to a group of your friends.
public speaking.tip: Show them what you're really interested in, one of them might think it's really cool too.

public speaking.title: Family Announcement
public speaking.description: Make an announcement to your family.
public speaking.tip: It can be anything, that you love them, something you want to get off your chest, or just telling them about some plans.

self awareness.title: Repeat
self awareness.description: Wear the same clothes you did yesterday.
self awareness.tip: Very few people will notice, and those who do notice don't mind

self awareness.title: Hug It Out
self awareness.tip: It can be a family member, or if you're feeling daring, a friend.

self awareness.title: Save Point
self awareness.description: Describe 4 experiences where you felt very anxious, and then think about how you could calm yourself down and write about that.
self awareness.tip: Be honest with yourself, no one else has to see your journal.

self awareness.title: People Watching
self awareness.description: Go somewhere public and watch the people for 30-60 minutes
self awareness.tip: People watching can be fun, and it can be helpful to see both how others perform normal tasks and mess up with confidence. It might even be good to take notes!

conversations.title: What Time is It?
conversations.description: Ask a stranger what time it is.
conversations.tip: Everyone has a phone or watch now, so it's easy for them to give you the time.

conversations.title: Talk to 5 People
conversations.tip: Everyone has a phone or watch now, so it's easy for them to give you the time.

conversations.title: Compliment
conversations.tip: If you're nice to others, they will likely be nice to you as well.

conversations.title: Which Way?
conversations.tip: It can be somewhere you already know the way to.

completing tasks.title: Hidden Items
completing tasks.description: Ask a cashier to buy something from the wall behind the counter.
completing tasks.tip: It's a normal part of the cashier's job, they won't think twice about it.

completing tasks.title: Family Dinner
completing tasks.description: Ask your family what kinds of food they like, then have them all help you cook a meal for the family.
completing tasks.tip: If you don't know how to cook, even better, have your family teach you, cooking is an important skill.

completing tasks.title: Clean Up
completing tasks.description: Ask your teacher to let you help clean up the classroom.
completing tasks.tip: It's good to be friends with your teacher.

completing tasks.title: Organizer
completing tasks.description: Invite all your friends to watch a movie together.
completing tasks.tip: Find something you want to see, odds are your friends will want to see it too!

social environments.title: Paper Cafe
social environments.description: Go to a nearby cafe and do your homework for the day there instead of at home.
social environments.tip: Cafes can be noisy sometimes, but they are good places to meet new people. If you get overwhelmed, try putting on headphones.

social environments.title: Hit the Stacks
social environments.description: Instead of doing your homework at home, work on it in a local library.
social environments.tip: If you can, meet up and study with a friend at the library.

social environments.title: Think Tank
social environments.description: Join a study group or club.
social environments.tip: People like to do things in groups, and studying can often lead into hanging out.

social environments.title: Take a Hike
social environments.description: Organize and go on a hike.
social environments.tip: You can go with just your family, or you can go with a bigger group, or just a couple friends. Each presents its own challenges.
